ingredients.ingredient: 1 (1.12 ounce) package Pace® Taco Seasoning Mix
1 (10.75 ounce) can Campbell's® Condensed Tomato Soup
1 ½ cups uncooked instant white rice

cookingTips: Brown the ground beef thoroughly and pour off excess fat to prevent the final dish from being greasy
Use instant rice to meet the 15-minute timeframe; regular rice will not cook in time
Keep the heat on low after covering to prevent boiling over and ensure the rice cooks evenly
Add toppings (salsa, cheese, lettuce) right before serving so the chips stay crispy when dipped
For extra flavor, brown the beef with diced onions and garlic before adding the taco seasoning
enrichment.coachingPrompt: I'm making 15-Minute Dinner Nachos Supreme and need step-by-step guidance. Please walk me through: (1) how to properly brown 1 pound of ground beef in a skillet and when to add the taco seasoning, (2) the correct technique for draining fat from the meat, (3) how to combine the soup, water, and instant rice without lumps, (4) the exact cooking time and temperature needed for the rice to be tender, (5) how to layer and garnish with salsa, cheddar cheese, and lettuce for best presentation, and (6) tips for keeping tortilla chips crispy while serving. Include timing so I can have everything ready in 15 minutes.
